name: places/ChIJuaetKXZZwokR9KFYog4o-QI
formattedAddress: 273 E 10th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 273 E 10th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text:
Listen, I have both tattoos and anxiety, and maybe everyone else in the world walks into tattoo shops (or anywhere else) and feels immediately at ease and not at all intimidated, but in the event there's even one other anxious person trying to get some tattoos, let me go ahead and put this on the internet – Clash City's the right shop for you.

I knew conceptually what I wanted (a Clash tattoo, fittingly), but I don't live in the city or even on the right coast, so I had to do everything over email. Even that – sending a cold email to a total stranger who you want to permanently mark your body – takes some ~psyching up for me, but once I jumped that mental hurdle at Clash City, I didn't encounter it again, because not only is Baz cool, he's also easy to work with and easy to talk to.

We nailed down a design over email and he worked around my work schedule/flights, which meant I was getting tattooed on a Friday the 13th. I got to watch Baz and his crew compete (and, like, definitely medal) in the Olympics of Patience as the line grew longer as people got off work, and not once did any of them sound aggravated or snappish or too cool or whatever other bad scene could've formed in a situation like that.

My own tattoo was exactly what I wanted, healed well, and Baz's touch is light enough that I actually noticed how light it was. They do all sorts of styles (like The Clash does all sorts of music, like deliberately, which is a cool premise for a shop).

For the other anxious people pre-planning every bit of their tattoo-getting, including how you're gonna fill a bunch of hours with a stranger and their inky needle machine, we talked about stuff like The Buzzcocks and Doctor Who (...and The Clash) – Baz and everyone else working that day were Genuinely Nice People totally uninterested in making other people feel small by making themselves look cooler. He even made sure after I left that I knew where the Joe Strummer mural was and to not to forget to check it out.

Would recommend and will be back! Thanks, Baz!

originalText.text: Got 3 old tattoos of mine fixed by Logan. Did a great job and was very friendly and accommodating.

originalText.text: got my first tattoo here and it was amazing!!! my friend and i had brian and he was so funny and nice, and he did a great job! will definitely be going back
